@strongduanmu 
Hi, this is [my github demo](https://github.com/NOLouser/shardingsphere5.0.0_demo).Please read README.md and do it.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33742097/147326707-c9d67dab-abe2-4137-9bc6-632c0da8d070.png)

> Can you provider your configuration?

yml:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96333264/147327043-fca7d41c-ccbd-4ab3-b5fd-5a192e219da5.png)
pom：
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96333264/147327186-bcc513bd-e977-43c0-9cc7-040e37001c39.png)

@NOLouser Yes, it will only load one table, because sharding tables are all same, so for tableMetaData, we only need one table.
Hi, I would like to work on this issue.

@tuichenchuxin 
Hi, this is not the problem I want to point out. I want to say,  if multiple logical tables map to one actual table(like logicTable t_order, t_order_hint all map to one actualTable t_order_202112 ), it will only create one logicTable tableMetaData(the other logicTable tableMetaData will be lost), and it will cause problems when using the lost logicTable tableMetaData. Please take a look at [my example demo](https://github.com/NOLouser/shardingsphere5.0.0_demo).

@tuichenchuxin 
Hi, because shardingSphere not support serveral sharding strategies for one logicTable, but we can use one sharding strategy for one logicTable, and that will need serveral logicTables map to one actualTable. Please look at [this official reply](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/issues/8820).
@NOLouser Oh, I get it. I'll fix this issue later.

@tuichenchuxin 
Thanks a lot!
@NOLouser By the way, are you willing to fix this problem?
